definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: He was seconded to the Sales Department for two years.
sentences.chinese: 她被临时调派到销售部去工作两年。

sentences.english: They rushed more troops to the front.
sentences.chinese: 他们急速调派了更多的部队奔赴前线。

sentences.english: A team of highly trained monkeys has been dispatched to deal with this situation.
sentences.chinese: 一队被高度锻炼地山公曾经被调派去解决这个问题啦。

sentences.english: He sends a car to pick her up.
sentences.chinese: 托尼调派了一辆车去接她回来。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold dispatching a hand came to McCullough has dwellings.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金调派一个手下来到罗成住处。

definition: to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
to dispatch (vehicles, staff etc)/to schedule/to manage/dispatcher/scheduler
